title: Check for 'wilful default' in NPA accounts exceeding Rs 25 lakh: RBI to banks
description: The RBI released new guidelines for banks and NBFCs to tackle wilful defaulters, mandating scrutiny of accounts with outstanding debts of Rs 25 lakh and above. Lenders have a six-month window to classify a borrower as a wilful defaulter. No additional credit will be given to these defaulters for a year post removal from the list.
